page.title: 11THE SMIDDY OF YESTERDAY
page.content: THERE HAS BEEN A SMIDDY IN COUSLAND SINCE 1703. MR. KIT SKED, WHO IS 72, HAS BEEN A BLACKSMITH FOR 54 YEARS. HE IS THE LAST OF FOUR GENERATIONS OF BLACKSMITHS AND WILL RETIRE THIS YEAR. HE USED TO LIVE IN THE OLD HOUSE NEXT TO THE SMIDDY, BUT IT WAS CONDEMNED 30 YEARS AGO. THEN, HE WORKED FROM 7AM. TILL 8PM. BUT NOWADAYS HE WORKS 10.30AM. - 2.30PM. THE SMIDDY USED TO BE THE HUB OF THE VILLAGE. IF YOU WENT TO THE SMIDDY, YOU DIDN'T NEED A NEWSPAPER SAYS MR. SKED. AT ONE TIME HE SHOD 5 HORSES A DAY, USING THREE FIRES WITH HAND BELLOWS AND 10 TONS OF COAL PER YEAR AT Â£1 PER TON. OTHER JOBS USED TO BE MENDING CART WHEELS, SHARPENING AND MENDING PLOUGHS OR FARM TOOLS. LIFE IN COUSLAND SMIDDY HAS CHANGED OVER THE YEARS.
